header.title: Spells: Spellcraft to Bring Magic to Your Life and Reality to Your Desires

central_thesis: The central thesis of 'Spells' is that ordinary individuals can effectively harness universal energies to manifest desires and improve their lives through simple, accessible spellcraft. This is achieved by manipulating symbolic objects, cultivating intuition, and employing potent visualization, all within a framework of positive intent and without recourse to 'dark magic.' The book aims to democratize magic, presenting it as a practical tool for daily challenges and aspirations, drawing from diverse folk traditions.

structure_content.summary: This section introduces the foundational concepts of spellcraft, defining it as the performance of mini-rituals using natural and material items. It outlines the core magical principles of 'sympathetic' and 'empathic' magic, emphasizing their application in rituals. The author stresses the accessibility of ingredients, the importance of personal intuition, and powerful visualization as key components for successful spellcasting. It explicitly denounces negative magic, promoting a positive and ethical approach to practice.

This chapter provides a detailed overview of the essential tools and techniques employed in the book's spellcraft system. It meticulously lists and describes common magical implements such as candles (emphasizing natural waxes), oil lamps, various types of cloth, brand-new pins and needles, a range of crystals and minerals, and the proper storage for magical oils and powders in colored bottles. Crucially, it includes an astrological guide, linking specific planets to days of the week and their associated magical powers for optimal timing of rituals.

Dedicated to romantic and relational magic, this section offers practical spells for attracting love, maintaining fidelity, and revitalizing relationships. Recipes include 'A Love Powder' for psychic bonding, an 'Aromatherapy Love Philter' to enhance intimacy, charms to retrieve stray lovers, and bewitchments to revive 'lusterless relationships.' The chapter also provides a charm to deter unwanted attentions and highlights the significance of Friday, ruled by Venus, as the auspicious day for love spells.

This chapter focuses on attracting wealth and abundance through positive thought and ritual. It presents formulas for 'Prosperity Oil' and 'Water of Plenty,' designed to draw financial energies when anointed on personal items or added to bath/wash water. A 'Jovial Talisman of Wealth and Abundance' is detailed, incorporating numerology and planetary timing (Thursday/Jupiter). The section concludes with a 'Money Magnet' spell and a collection of traditional prosperity charms and omens.

Addressing the mercurial energies of chance, this chapter provides formulas and rituals to enhance general luck and success, including specific applications for gambling. It introduces 'Fortuna Oil' for anointing charms and hands, 'Cornucopia Powder' for drawing success, and the 'Four Winds Wishing Spell' for carrying desires into the universe. Practical charms like 'A Key to Respect and Favor' and various traditional gambling charms are also detailed.

This section outlines spells and charms for safeguarding the self and property from negative influences, including psychic vampirism and the 'evil eye.' It provides a 'Protection Oil' formula aligned with Mars and Saturn energies, a 'Mexican Charm Bag for Protection' involving herbs and stones, and a 'Talisman for Protection' based on the 'Sator Square' acrostic. Various miscellaneous protection charms and their uses are also described.

Focused on professional well-being, this chapter offers spells to improve one's working life. It includes 'A Charm to Secure Employment' for job searching, 'A Magical Powder to Create a Harmonious Working Environment' to pacify hostile colleagues, an 'Enchantment to Obtain a Coveted Promotion' using candle magic, and 'A Spell to Deal with a Difficult Boss' involving a 'go away' powder and specific invocations to assert boundaries.

This chapter is dedicated to the magical protection and nurturing of children. It describes 'A Rite to Place a Newborn Under the Guidance and Protection of the Universe,' 'A Spell to Call a Child's Guardian Angel' for defense against bullies, 'A Spell to Halt Nightmares' using a sigil and protective ingredients, and 'A Spell for Popularity' to help children form friendships. The emphasis is on fostering creativity and self-love in the child.

Addressing the energetic well-being of the dwelling, this chapter provides spells to purify, bless, and protect the home. Rituals include 'A Spell to Purify and Bless a Dwelling' for new or troubled homes, 'A Magical Water to Bring Peace to a Troubled Home' for conflict resolution, 'A Spell to Compel a Troublesome Neighbor to Retreat,' and 'A Spell to Protect the Home from Thieves and Intruders' utilizing spider web magic. It also offers 'Magical Aromatherapy for the Home' blends for various purposes.

This section explores the magical properties of food, detailing methods for blessing and empowering prepared meals to imbue them with specific energies. It discusses the 'Power of Fasting Before a Spell' as a method of concentrating will, and provides recipes for 'Magical Herbal Teas' for various magical intentions. The chapter categorizes 'Foods of Love,' 'Foods of Prosperity,' 'Foods to Promote Protection,' and 'Foods of Luck and Success,' suggesting presentation themes for magical meals.

The final chapter extends spellcraft to global concerns, emphasizing the interconnectedness of individual action and planetary well-being. It offers 'A Spell for World Peace and a Pure World Environment,' encouraging practitioners to nullify negative energy and contribute to environmental protection. Additionally, 'A Spell for Safety in World Travel' is provided for protecting oneself or loved ones during journeys, utilizing a charmed amulet and planetary invocation.

key_concepts.definition: The practice of performing 'highly creative mini rituals' using symbolic objects and personal energies to achieve desired outcomes and bring magic into one's life. It is an individual process of interaction with people and the earth on a spiritual level, emphasizing faith and inner belief.

A form of enchantment where a symbol is used to represent a person or thing, and other symbols are employed to act upon it, thereby manifesting the desired outcome in reality. An example is using a candle to represent a lover and anointing it with oils to attract them.

A magical principle where a part of an object is used to represent the whole. This is exemplified by using a person's signature, hair, or an article of clothing to represent that individual, believing that magic performed on the part will affect the whole through a 'psychic bond'.

An essential technique in spellcrafting, regarded as the 'fuel' of a spell. It involves mentally picturing the desired outcome in fine detail and experiencing the joy of its success as if it has already occurred, thereby directing powerful energy towards the goal. It requires full belief in the goal's attainability and sustained positive thoughts.

An essential part of spellcrafting, described as the 'softer tone of our inner voice' or the guidance from one's 'higher selves.' It is cultivated through meditation and stilling the mind, allowing the practitioner to make correct decisions and understand how to best apply magical principles.

A specially created magical device designed to both represent and attract a particular influence or condition into the life of the bearer, such as wealth or protection. Unlike an amulet, its primary function is active attraction rather than repulsion.

A magical object created and used to repel a specific threat or negative influence, such as the evil eye. Its primary function is passive protection or deflection, contrasting with the active attraction of a talisman.

The practice of timing spells for performance on particular days of the week, based on the belief that each day is ruled by a specific planet (Sun, Moon, or one of the five classical planets) and that these planets govern different facets of human endeavor, thus maximizing a spell's efficacy.

practical_system.description: The practical system in 'Spells' is an eclectic blend of folk magic, sympathetic/empathic principles, aromatherapy, and visualization, anchored in personal will and positive intent. Rituals involve the manipulation of symbolic objects (herbs, oils, candles, crystals, personal items) carefully chosen for their energetic correspondences, often guided by astrological timing (planetary days). The core operative mechanics rely on: 1) Intentional Visualization, serving as the 'fuel' to direct magical energy; 2) Intuition, developed through meditation, to guide spell construction and application; and 3) Affirmation/Incantation, to verbally charge and declare the spell's purpose. The system strictly adheres to an ethical framework, advocating only for positive magic and emphasizing that 'negativity can only beget negativity.'

rituals: A Love Powder: Creation and application of a talcum-based powder infused with essential oils (rose, sandalwood, lavender) and herbs (cardamom, allspice, crushed lavender/rose petals), sprinkled on desired person's belongings and the self, and ceremonially blown to the cardinal points with visualization of psychic love bonding.

An Aromatherapy Love Philter: Blending essential oils (patchouli, orange, cinnamon, clove, optional vetiver) for burning in an oil burner to inspire lovemaking or anointing red candles (13 times, reciting desired person's name 169 times) to draw a person near.

A Charm to Bring Back a Stray Lover: Arranging five red candles in a circle, smearing them with honey, sugar, and cinnamon, placing a photograph of the absent lover in the center, lighting candles, and calling their name 109 times with visualization of their return, then wrapping the photo in red cloth.

A Spell to Keep a Lover or Spouse Faithful: Combining personal effects (lover's hair) with rose water, sugar, ground ginger root, cinnamon, and cardamom seed in a bottle, sealed and tied with a yellow ribbon, then placed under the shared bed.

Jovial Talisman of Wealth and Abundance: Drawing a numerological sigil (414151, 97612, 511108, 162313) on purple card with silver/gold ink on a Thursday, depicting a horseshoe/hammer on the back, consecrating with a purple candle and incense (pine, bergamot, cedar, sage) with visualization of falling gold, then carrying in a purple pouch or hiding at a bank.

Four Winds Wishing Spell: Holding a chosen powdered herb (bay, rosemary, cinnamon, vervain, cardamom, peppermint) and imbuing it with a detailed wish through breath and visualization, then facing each cardinal point (North, East, South, West) and blowing a quarter of the herb while reciting specific invocations to elemental spirits and winds.

A Spell to Purify and Bless a Dwelling: Arranging incense, salt water, bread, a white candle, and a bell in a circle, lighting candle/incense, sprinkling salt water with purification chant, walking through the home with candle (truth/wisdom chant), ringing bell (love/joy chant), leaving bread in rooms (abundance/prosperity chant), and wafting incense (peace/harmony chant).

A Spell to Halt Nightmares: Copying the 'ABRACADABRA' triangular sigil onto purple card/paper, spraying the room with a mixture of salt, water, and perfume, and placing a raw potato under the child's bed (replaced weekly) to absorb negativity with protective incantations.

A Spell for Safety in World Travel: Coiling fine copper wire around an orange candle on a Wednesday dawn, holding a blue bead, and reciting an invocation to 'Little King Mercury' for vigilance and protection, then anointing the bead (amulet) with lemongrass oil and carrying it.

critical_analysis.relevance: 'Spells' by Matthew Green is highly relevant within contemporary occultism for its accessible and positive approach to practical magic. It positions spellcraft as a tool for personal empowerment and self-improvement, diverging from more complex ceremonial or grimoire traditions by emphasizing readily available materials and intuitive practice. This demystification of magic, coupled with its ethical stance against 'dark magic,' makes it a foundational text for those new to the field, fostering a sense of agency and connection to spiritual forces for everyday desires. Its eclectic blend of folk traditions from the Caribbean, American South, Europe, Native American cultures, and Brazil provides a broad, culturally inclusive perspective on practical magic.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience for 'Spells' is the beginner or novice practitioner interested in practical magic, folk traditions, and self-help through ritual. This includes individuals seeking non-dogmatic spiritual paths, those looking for accessible ways to address personal challenges (love, money, protection, career), and parents interested in magical methods for their children's well-being. The book's emphasis on harmlessness, ease of ingredient acquisition, and the power of personal visualization also appeals to a broader audience curious about magic but wary of complex or negative practices.
